titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Virginia Office of the Second Auditor - Literary Fund Records, 1785-1927
titlestmt.subtitle: Virginia. Office of the Second Auditor. Literary Fund Records SAI 30
titlestmt.author: Renee M. Savits

titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Virginia Office of the Second Auditor - Literary Fund Records, 1785-1927
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
the Library of Virginia SAI 30

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Virginia. Office of the Second Auditor. Literary Fund Records, 1785-1927
did.origination: Virginia. Office of the Second Auditor.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Virginia Office of the Second Auditor. Literary Fund Records, 1785-1927. Accession SAI 30, State government records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: The Literary Fund, which is still in existence, was established by an act passed by the General Assembly on 12 February 1811. Revenues derived from fines (except militia fines) and the sale of land escheated for unpaid taxes were deposited in the Literary Fund and the money was used to build schools and educate the state's poor children. The responsibility for keeping the accounts of the Literary Fund was shifted from the auditor to the second auditor when the latter office was created on 24 February 1823.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Records, 1785-1927, including accounts, bonds, correspondence, deeds, escheated lands, lists, reports, treasurer receipts, and vouchers of the Second Auditor Literary Fund.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged alphabetically by folder title, with oversized materials arranged to the rear.
